snippet: Two new lawsuits were filed against the department on Tuesday over the 2011 death of a man whom the police tried to subdue with a Taser gun.
abstract: Two lawsuits are filed against Ferguson Police Department over 2011 death of Jason Moore, who died after police tried to subdue him with a Taser gun; Moore's death and how the department handed it are receiving new scrutiny after Police Officer Darren Wilson shot and killed Michael Brown, unarmed black teenager.

byline.original: By JOHN ELIGON and MICHAEL S. SCHMIDT
byline.contributor: John Eligon reported from Ferguson, and Michael S. Schmidt from Washington. Reporting was contributed by Mosi Secret, Joseph Goldstein and Dan Barry from Ferguson, Matt Apuzzo from Washington, and Kitty Bennett from Seattle.

lead_paragraph: Two new lawsuits were filed against the department on Tuesday over the 2011 death of a man whom the police tried to subdue with a Taser gun.

headline.main: In Ferguson, Scrutiny on Police Is Growing
headline.print_headline: Scrutiny on the Police Is Building in Ferguson
